solution_line_template: There are a total of {num_teams} teams * {members_per_team} members per team = <<{num_teams}*{members_per_team}={total_members}>>{total_members} team members.

Each person receives {pairs_competing} pair of competing roller skates + {pairs_backup} pair of backup roller skates = <<{pairs_competing}+{pairs_backup}={pairs_per_member}>>{pairs_per_member} pairs of roller skates.
So there are a total of {total_members} team members * {pairs_per_member} pairs of roller skates per team member = <<{total_members}*{pairs_per_member}={total_pairs}>>{total_pairs} roller skates.

There were therefore {total_pairs} roller skates * {sets_of_laces_per_pair} sets of laces per pair of roller skates = <<{total_pairs}*{sets_of_laces_per_pair}={total_laces}>>{total_laces} sets of laces handed out.
